item.title: Sarah add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "When I say it's you I like, I'm talking about that part of you that knows that life is far more than anything you can ever see or hear or touch. That deep part of you that allows you to stand for those things without which humankind cannot survive. Love that conquers hate, peace that rises triumphant over war, and justice that proves more powerful than greed." -- Fred Rogers

item.title: Sarah add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Piglet noticed that even though he had a Very Small Heart, it could hold a rather large amount of Gratitude." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I don't know the question, but sex is definitely the answer." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The mystery of love is greater than the mystery of death." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Where there is sorrow, there is holy ground." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Martin Luther
item.description: "Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree." -- Martin Luther

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Donâ€™t go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sarah add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "Only connect!" -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Sarah add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "I do like Christmas on the whole.... In its clumsy way, it does approach Peace and Goodwill. But it is clumsier every year." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Sarah add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "Long books, when read, are usually overpraised, because the reader wishes to convince others and himself that he has not wasted his time." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Gerard Manley Hopkins
Sarah add a quote by Gerard Manley Hopkins
item.description: "The world is charged with the grandeur of God." -- Gerard Manley Hopkins

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Gerard Manley Hopkins
item.description: "And for all this, nature is never spent; There lives the dearest freshness deep down things; And though the last lights off the black West went Oh, morning, at the brown brink eastward, springsâ€” Because the Holy Ghost over the bent World broods with warm breast and with ah! bright wings." -- Gerard Manley Hopkins

item.title: Sarah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Do I dare Disturb the universe? In a minute there is time For decisions and revisions which a minute will reverse." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Sarah add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "We have lingered in the chambers of the sea By sea-girls wreathed with seaweed red and brown Till human voices wake us... and we drown." -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: Sarah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "I will show you fear in a handful of dust." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Sarah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "I grow old â€¦ I grow old â€¦ I shall wear the bottoms of my trousers rolled." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Sarah add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "I suggest that the only books that influence us are those for which we are ready, and which have gone a little further down our particular path than we have yet gone ourselves." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Sarah add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "Oh, I don't know, you know, don't you know?" -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Sarah add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "It was one of those cases where you approve the broad, general principle of an idea but can't help being in a bit of a twitter at the prospect of putting it into practical effect. I explained this to Jeeves, and he said much the same thing had bothered Hamlet." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Wodehouse
Sarah add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "He has no enemies, but is intensely disliked by his friends." -- Oscar Wilde
